title: Three years into Russia's invasion of Ukraine, Europe weakened by anti-system and far-right movements
summary: The military deadlock, fatigue of public opinion and fear of escalation are all working in Moscow's favor, to the detriment of Europe, at a time when the latter is being abandoned by its American ally. A fault line is opening up on the continent between states determined to protect themselves and those advocating appeasement.

title: Macron warns Ukraine peace can't mean 'surrender,' after Trump talks
summary: The French president said that both leaders wanted a 'solid, long-lasting peace' at a joint press conference with his American counterpart on Monday, adding that he wanted 'strong' US involvement in any such plan.

title: Trump says Canada, Mexico tariffs moving 'forward' on schedule
summary: The US president, shortly after taking office, announced duties of up to 25% on Canadian and Mexican imports, citing illegal immigration and the flow of deadly fentanyl. But he issued a last-minute halt to the levies for a month as talks continued.

title: Secret Service agent who leaped to shield Kennedy from assassination dead at 93
summary: Clint Hill was a member of First Lady Jacqueline Kennedy's protective detail in Dallas, Texas, on November 22, 1963, when the president was shot by Lee Harvey Oswald while riding in an open car. Hill shielded the bodies of Kennedy and his wife during the ride to the hospital, where the president was declared dead.

title: France's largest child sexual abuse trial: 'I've done hideous things'
summary: Former surgeon Joël Le Scouarnec went on trial Monday for raping or abusing 299 victims, mostly child patients, in a case spanning over three decades.

title: Animal consent: For frogs, no means no!
summary: 'What does the bestiary have to say?' In nature, contrary to popular belief, it is often impossible for a male to approach a female unless she has first given her consent.

title: With election win, Friedrich Merz, rival of Angela Merkel, has revenge
summary: The 69-year-old CDU candidate is set to become chancellor at a time when Germany is going through a deep economic, security and identity crisis.

title: Islamic Jihad says Israeli tanks part of 'plans to annex West Bank by force'
summary: The group, which has fought alongside Hamas in Gaza and has a strong presence in the northern West Bank, denounced 'a new act of aggression,' which it said was 'aimed at uprooting our people from their land.' The International Committee of the Red Cross said many residents who fled have taken shelter in "crowded mosques and schools."

title: Gérard Depardieu probed for tax fraud and money laundering
summary: The French actor is suspected of falsely declaring his tax residency to be in Belgium since 2013.

title: How investigators found France's 'biggest bandit,' and what comes next after arrest in Romania
summary: Since his deadly escape from a prison van last year, Mohamed Amra, known as 'The Fly,' had disappeared. The manhunt, involving around 100 investigators, came to an end in Bucharest on Saturday.

title: US joins Russia to vote against UN resolution condemning Russia for Ukraine war
summary: The UN General Assembly passed a European-backed resolution demanding Russia’s immediate withdrawal, rejecting a US proposal that failed to name Moscow as the aggressor.

title: World leaders in Kyiv to mark three years of war in Ukraine as Zelensky hails 'resistance'
summary: The EU's Ursula von der Leyen and Canada's Justin Trudeau leaders arrived in Kyiv on Monday to mark Russia's invasion of Ukraine three years ago on February 24, 2022.

title: German elections: Far-right AfD party achieves historic result
summary: Alternative for Germany (AfD), which garnered 20.8% of the vote, is now the country's second strongest political force. The party imposed immigration as a major theme during the campaign and enjoyed the support of the Trump administration.

title: Roberta Flack, R&B icon known for 'Killing Me Softly,' dies at 88
summary: The Grammy-winning singer and pianist of the 1970s captivated audiences with her intimate vocal style. Beyond music, she was a powerful cultural presence, who used her artistry to support various social movements.

title: Explosives thrown at Russian consulate in Marseille on Ukraine war anniversary
summary: France 'condemned' an attack on the Russian consulate in Marseille after three explosive devices were thrown at the building. A police source, speaking to Agence France-Presse, said two devices were detonated.

title: Trump names loyalist podcaster as FBI deputy director
summary: Dan Bongino, a former New York police officer and Secret Service agent, hosts a popular right-wing podcast, backing the US president through misinformation and attacking his opponents.

title: How the US went from supporting Ukraine to abandoning it
summary: With Donald Trump's return to the White House, the US president is threatening to put an abrupt end to three years of continuous assistance to Kyiv, with no clear picture of a possible outcome.

title: 'Warren Buffett reminds Donald Trump of a basic economic responsibility: Keep the dollar stable'
summary: In his annual letter to shareholders published on Saturday, the Berkshire Hathaway boss urged the US president to spend government money 'wisely,' and warned him of the inflationary crisis that could result from his policies, analyzes Le Monde's Isabelle Chaperon.

title: Ukraine rupture grows as US sides with Russia at UN
summary: As US President Donald Trump stakes out a new position on the Ukraine war, Washington and Russia aligned first at a morning vote at the General Assembly and again at an afternoon vote of the Security Council.

title: Pope Francis shows slight improvement and resumes some work, while still critical, Vatican says
summary: The Vatican’s evening bulletin was more upbeat than in recent days, as the 88-year-old Francis battles pneumonia in both lungs at Rome's Gemelli hospital for the 11th day.

title: The death of Roberta Flack, the gentle-voiced African American singer of 'Killing Me Softly With His Song'
summary: The American singer, pianist, and composer, who suffered from ALS, has died at the age of 88.

title: Putin and Trump: A patient strategist facing a hasty and unpredictable force
summary: In power in Moscow for 25 years, Russian President Vladimir Putin is taking his time to gauge his US counterpart Donald Trump and respond to his proposals for a rapid agreement in Ukraine.

title: Madrid shocked by removal of Spanish from US president's internet site
summary: A few hours after Donald Trump's inauguration, and as during his first term in office, the language of Cervantes, though spoken by nearly 58 million people in the US, disappeared from the official White House website and networks.

title: Heavy fighting in Sudan forces Doctors Without Borders to stop aid at a camp with 500,000 people
summary: The escalation made it 'impossible' for the group to provide lifesaving humanitarian help to thousands of displaced people, it said in a statement

title: Biodiversity: A catch-up session in Rome to try to bring COP16 to a close
summary: After being abruptly suspended in Colombia in late 2024, the 16th United Nations Biodiversity Conference will resume in Italy. The question of financing nature protection will once again be at the heart of the discussions.

title: Trump calls for revival of Keystone XL Pipeline project axed by Biden
summary: The 1,210-mile (1,950-kilometer) pipeline, part of which was completed, was to transport up to 830,000 barrels of oil per day from the Alberta oil sands to Nebraska, which then would travel through an existing system to refineries in coastal Texas.

title: Trump-Macron meeting illustrates growing distance between allies
summary: Visiting Washington, the French president tried to influence the US position on the war in Ukraine, seeking security guarantees in the event of a ceasefire with Russia. But the US president made no commitment.

title: 'JD Vance's illiberalism doesn't just criticize liberal and progressive values, it advances a real political project'
summary: After the US vice president's speech in Munich, supporters of political liberalism must stop believing their model is hegemonic, and get down to the ideological arena if they hope to convince others, writes historian Marlène Laruelle.

title: Germany's Merz wants quick coalition formation to finance defense effort
summary: The Christian Democrat, whose party won the parliamentary elections, quickly began negotiating with the Social Democrats to secure a majority in parliament. The likely future chancellor insists the country cannot delay the military investments needed due to US disengagement.

title: Pedophile former surgeon admits in court to 'hideous acts'
summary: On the first day of France's largest-ever child sexual abuse trial, Joël Le Scouarnec, accused of rape and sexual assault against 299 victims, acknowledged the irreparable nature of his crimes.

title: Andrey Kurkov: 'Ukrainians have stopped believing in a happy ending to this war'
summary: In an interview with Le Monde, the Ukrainian writer said that a potential ceasefire agreement will not mark the end of the conflict.

title: Abandoned by Trump on Ukraine, Europeans strive to close ranks
summary: Ursula von der Leyen and several heads of state and government visited Kyiv on Monday, to mark the third anniversary of the Russian invasion. At the same time, the 27 member states' foreign ministers, meeting in Brussels, adopted a 16th package of sanctions against Moscow.

title: New search for Malaysia Airlines flight launched a decade after disappearance
summary: Maritime exploration firm Ocean Infinity has resumed efforts to locate missing Malaysia Airlines flight MH370, Malaysian transport minister Anthony Loke announced.

title: French authorities arrest two over explosives thrown at Russian consulate in Marseille
summary: Three improvised explosive devices were thrown at the Russian consulate in the southern French port city of Marseille on Monday, but no one was injured, a police source said.

title: Dismantling of two Dan Graham works in France disappoints artist's estate
summary: The French cities of Nantes and La Rochelle have decided to remove two pavilions by the late American artist Dan Graham from public space.

title: Nice church attack suspect admits at trial to killing three people, expressing no remorse
summary: For the first time, Brahim Aouissaoui confessed to committing three murders on October 29, 2020, without going into details. He expressed no regret, claiming the 'right' to avenge Muslims killed around the world.

title: War in Ukraine: 'One of Europe's strengths in negotiations is that they carry part of the burden, something Trump ignores'
summary: On a visit to the White House on Monday, Emmanuel Macron is expected to detail proposals by Paris and London to deploy troops in Ukraine to guarantee a ceasefire. Le Monde's diplomacy correspondent Philippe Ricard answered readers' questions in a live blog.

title: NGOs ask ICC to investigate Biden's complicity in 'Israeli war crimes' in Gaza
summary: Two human rights organizations have submitted a document to the International Criminal Court accusing the former US president, as well as his Secretary of State Antony Blinken, and his Secretary of Defense Lloyd Austin.

title: EU sanctions Promtech, company suspected of supplying Russian army
summary: On Monday, February 24, the European Council unveiled its 16th set of sanctions, targeting a Russian company whose practices were revealed in an investigation by Le Monde last year.

title: 'Trump's economic policy lack any coherence'
summary: One month into the American president's return to the White House, the world is divided between astonishment and fascination. Meanwhile, inflation is rising again, and the effectiveness of public spending cuts remains a facade, says Stéphane Lauer.

title: 'Crises are Macron's fuel, and Europe is his strongest asset'
summary: Since 2017, the French president has developed a clear and prescient vision for Europe's global role, allowing him to make a comeback after his calamitous decision to call early elections, writes Le Monde columnist Françoise Fressoz.
